segment.source: Back Up the Archive
segment.target: Back Up the Archive

segment.source: Back Up the Archive
segment.target: Back Up the Archive

segment.source: Back Up the Archive
segment.target: Back Up the Archive

segment.source: To help in the recovery of the archive for Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) if there is a disaster, an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) should back up the archive frequently.
segment.target: To help in the recovery of the archive for Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) if there is a disaster, an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) should back up the archive frequently.

segment.source: By default, the archive is created in %ProgramData%MicrosoftAGPM.
segment.target: By default, the archive is created in %ProgramData%MicrosoftAGPM.

segment.source: However, you can specify a different path during the setup of Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management - Server.
segment.target: However, you can specify a different path during the setup of Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management - Server.

segment.source: A user account that has access to both the AGPM Server—the computer on which the AGPM Service is installed—and to the folder that contains the archive is required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: A user account that has access to both the AGPM Server—the computer on which the AGPM Service is installed—and to the folder that contains the archive is required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: To back up the archive
segment.target: To back up the archive

segment.source: Stop the AGPM Service.
segment.target: Stop the AGPM Service.

segment.source: For more information, see Start and Stop the AGPM Service.
segment.target: For more information, see Start and Stop the AGPM Service.

segment.source: Back up the archive folder by using Windows Explorer, Xcopy, Windows Server® Backup, or another backup tool.
segment.target: Back up the archive folder by using Windows Explorer, Xcopy, Windows Server® Backup, or another backup tool.

segment.source: Make sure that you back up hidden, system, and read-only files.
segment.target: Make sure that you back up hidden, system, and read-only files.

segment.source: Store the archive backup in a secure location.
segment.target: Store the archive backup in a secure location.

segment.source: Restart the AGPM Service.
segment.target: Restart the AGPM Service.

segment.source: For more information, see Start and Stop the AGPM Service.
segment.target: For more information, see Start and Stop the AGPM Service.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If an AGPM Administrator backs up the archive infrequently, the Group Policy Objects (GPOs) in the archive backup will not be current.
segment.target: If an AGPM Administrator backs up the archive infrequently, the Group Policy Objects (GPOs) in the archive backup will not be current.

segment.source: To better ensure that the archive backup is current, back up the archive as part of your organization’s daily backup strategy.
segment.target: To better ensure that the archive backup is current, back up the archive as part of your organization’s daily backup strategy.

segment.target: Additional references

segment.target: Restore the Archive from a Backup
